Description: This feature covers the functionality of the Autolytics screen in the Jewel ecosystem

Scenarios.Scenario: Verify Link Change after Clicking to Autolytics button

Steps.Description: navigate to login-screen
login to jewel website
Click on the Autolytics screen
the page link should change

Scenarios.Scenario: Request Access to Projects in Autolytics

Steps.Description: user is on Autolytics screen
there are no projects available
the user clicks on the Request Access button
the user should be navigated to the Admin tab and create a new project
verify the project is created

Scenarios.Scenario: Verify Total Number of Projects Displayed in Autolytics

Steps.Description: navigate to Autolytics screen
user look at the "Total projects " column
user should see the expected total number of projects as "1"

Scenarios.Scenario: Verify Active Users Count

Steps.Description: user is on Autolytics screen
user look at the Active User column
user should see the expected number of active users as "1"

Scenarios.Scenario: Verify Automation TestCase Count

Steps.Description: user is on Autolytics screen
user look at the Automation TestCase column
user should see the expected number of Automated testcases as "0"

Scenarios.Scenario: Verify Manual TestCase Count

Steps.Description: user is on Autolytics screen
user look at the Manual TestCase column
user should see the expected number of Manual testcases as "0"

Scenarios.Scenario: Verify the Increase in Pass and Fail Scenarios

Steps.Description: user is on Autolytics screen
user click on MLab to create testcases
user create a folder named folderName in the MLab
user add a manual test case named testCaseName to the folder
user add test steps for testCaseName named testStepName
user go to ELab
user create a suite named suiteName in ELab
user import and add the testcases to the suite
user execute the suite
the report link should be available
user click on the report link
user assign testCaseOutcomes to the test steps
user save the changes
Click on the Autolytics screen
the number of "FAIL" test cases should increase by "1"

Scenarios.Scenario: Verify Suite Name in Latest Run and Project Name Matches

Steps.Description: user is on Autolytics screen
the name of the suite should appear under the Latest Run column
the suite name in Autolytics should match suiteName
the project name in Autolytics should match projectName

Scenarios.Scenario: Click on the View Report icon to View the report in New Tab

Steps.Description: user is on Autolytics screen
user click on the view report icon
user should see the report in the new tab

Scenarios.Scenario: Click on the TestCases Section and verify the name and number of the testcases

Steps.Description: user is on Autolytics screen
user click on the view report icon
user should see the report in the new tab
user navigate to the "Testcases" section
user should see "1" test cases
user should see the test case names

Scenarios.Scenario: Generate Suite Run Report in Autolytics

Steps.Description: Click on the Autolytics screen
user is on "Reporting" section
user should see "Create Report" button
user click on "Create Report" button
user should not fill all the details
validate the message as "All fields are required !"
close the report
user click on "Create Report" button
user fill the details and generate "Suite Run Report" the report successfully
validate edit report button and check you're report selected has been generated or not "Suite Summary Report"

Scenarios.Scenario: Verify if user can change the name of the report

Steps.Description: Click on the Autolytics screen
user is on "Reporting" section
user double clicks on the report tab
user is able to change the name of the report to "Report"
verify if the name changes to "Report"

Scenarios.Scenario: Open and Interact with Detailed Report

Steps.Description: Click on the Autolytics screen
user is on "Overview" section
user click on the view report icon
user should see the report in the new tab
user navigate to the "Testcases" section
user click on the icon for a test case
the detailed report for that test case should open
user click on the "Collapse All" button
all test cases should be "collapsed"
user click on the "Expand All" button
all test cases should be "expanded"
user click on the "Copy Link" icon
user should be able to copy the report link
user click on the "View Report in New Tab" icon
user should see the report in the new tab

Scenarios.Scenario: Verify Search by Token and Timeline Selection

Steps.Description: user is on Autolytics screen
user click on the view report icon
user should see the report in the new tab
user navigate to the "Timeline" section
user enter the user token as "jewel" in search option
user should see "Total 1 Record(s) Found"

Scenarios.Scenario: Provide Expected Status to Manual Test Steps

Steps.Description: user is on Autolytics screen
user click on the view report icon
user should see the report in the new tab
user click on the link to provided under Autolytics Test Execution report heading
user should be taken to the page for providing expected status
user assign testCaseOutcomes to the test steps "<expected_status>"
user save the changes
the expected status for testCase should be updated to "<expected_status>"
Click on the Autolytics screen
the number of "<expected_status>" test cases should increase by "1"

Scenarios.Scenario: Validate Report Type and Heading Match

Steps.Description: user is on "Reporting" section
user click on "Create Report" button
user fill the details and generate "<selected_report_type>" the report
the report heading should match "<expected_report_heading>"

Scenarios.Scenario: Validate Date of the report

Steps.Description: user is on "Reporting" section
user click on "Create Report" button
user fill the details and "<select_date_range>" and generate "Suite Run Report" the report
the report heading should match "Suite Run Report"

Scenarios.Scenario: Add New Report Tab and Navigate Between Reports

Steps.Description: user is on "Reporting" section
user click on "Create Report" button
user fill the details and generate "Suite Run Report" the report
user click on the add icon to add a new report tab
a new report tab should be added
user click on the icon to navigate to the next report
user should be on the next report tab

Scenarios.Scenario: Open New Tab for Reports When No Tabs Exist

Steps.Description: user is on "Reporting" section
user should be able to access "Open New Tab" button
a new report tab should be created

Scenarios.Scenario: Delete the Project

Steps.Description: user is on Admin Screen
user clicked on delete button and deletes the project
